results.title: Buying for long-term use
results.creator_credit: Coronet Instructional Films and Spectrum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Shows a panel of consumers turning back the clock a year and telling how accurate their predictions have been for major purchases made a year ago. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Buying for immediate use
results.creator_credit: Frieda Dejarnette, Coronet Instructional Films and Spectrum Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
Rates the consumer shopping skills of three young shoppers making typical purchases for immediate use. Illustrates judging quality, price and service and determining which of these factors are valuable in making these purchases. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: Budgeting your money
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Consumer skills”.
This film shows four young people in different financial situations discussing their budgeting problems in conversations which lead to information on how budgets are made and carried out. Suitable for upper secondary level.

group_works.title: Treasures from the American Film Archives: 50 preserved films (MS)

results.title: Program 4 [DVD]
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Treasures from the American Film Archives: 50 preserved films (DVD)”.
For decades archives have worked behind the scenes to save America’s film heritage. Now for the first time, eighteen of the nation’s premier archives join forces to showcase the range of films that survive today thanks to their efforts. Essays about the archives narrated by Laurence Fishburne. Newly recorded musical scores by Martin Marks. This disk contains the following titles: Peepshow Kinetoscopes from 1894 1 min: ‘Luis Martinetti, Contortionist’, ‘Caicedo, King of the Slack Wire’—’Interior New York Subway’ (1905) 5 mins—’The Land Beyond the Sunset’ (1912) 14 mins—’I’m Insured’ (1916) 3 mins—’Snow White’ (1916) 63 mins—From ‘Beautiful Japan’ (1918) 15 mins—From ‘Rural Life in Maine’ (ca. 1930) 12 mins—’The News Parade of 1934’ (1934) 10 mins—’Rose Hobart’ (1936) 19 mins—’The Autobiography of a Jeep’ (1943) 10 mins—From ‘Marian Anderson: The Lincoln Memorial Concert’ (1939) 8 mins. Further Information: http://www.filmpreservation.org/

results.title: Program 3 [DVD]
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Treasures from the American Film Archives: 50 preserved films (DVD)”.
For decades archives have worked behind the scenes to save America’s film heritage. Now for the first time, eighteen of the nation’s premier archives join forces to showcase the range of films that survive today thanks to their efforts. Essays about the archives narrated by Laurence Fishburne. Newly recorded musical scores by Martin Marks. This disk contains the following titles: ‘The Thieving Hand’ (1908) 5 mins—’White Fawn’s Devotion’ (1910) 11 mins.—’The Chechahcos’ (1924) 86 mins—From ‘Japanese American Communities’ (1927-32) 7 mins—From Rare Aviation Films 13 mins: ‘The Keystone “Patrician”’ (1928), ‘The Zeppelin “Hindenburg”’ (1936)—’We Work Again’ (1937) 15 mins—From ‘La Valse’ (1951) 6 mins—’The Wall’ (1962) 10 mins—’George Dumpson’s Place’ (1965) 8 mins. Further Information: http://www.filmpreservation.org/

results.title: Program 2 [DVD]
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Treasures from the American Film Archives: 50 preserved films (DVD)”.
For decades archives have worked behind the scenes to save America’s film heritage. Now for the first time, eighteen of the nation’s premier archives join forces to showcase the range of films that survive today thanks to their efforts. Essays about the archives narrated by Laurence Fishburne. Newly recorded musical scores by Martin Marks. This disk contains the following titles: Paper print copyright deposits 7 min: ‘Star Theatre’ (1901), ‘Move On’ (1903), ‘Dog Factory’ (1904)—’The Lonedale Operator’ (1911), 17 mins—’Her Crowning Glory’ (1911), 14 mins—’The Toll of the Sea’ (1922) 54 mins—From ‘Accuracy First’ (ca. 1928), 5 mins—From West Virginia Documentaries 9 mins: ‘West Virginia, the State Beautiful’ (1929), ‘One-Room Schoolhouses’ (ca. 1935)—From ‘Early Amateur Sound Film’ (1936-37), 4 mins—’Composition 1’ (Themis) (1940), 4 mins—’The Battle of San Pietro’ (1945) 33 mins—’Negro Leagues Baseball’ (1946) 8 mins—’Battery Film’ (1985), 9 mins. Further Information: http://www.filmpreservation.org/

group.title: Treasures from the American Film Archives: 50 preserved films (DVD)

group_siblings.title: Treasures from the American Film Archives: 50 preserved films (MS)

results.title: Program 1 [DVD]
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Treasures from the American Film Archives: 50 preserved films (DVD)”.
For decades archives have worked behind the scenes to save America’s film heritage. Now for the first time, eighteen of the nation’s premier archives join forces to showcase the range of films that survive today thanks to their efforts. This disk contains the following titles: “The Original movie” (1922), 8 mins; early films from the Edison Company 3 mins - “Blacksmithing scene” (1893), “The Gay shoe clerk” (1903), “Three American beauties” (1906); “Princess Nicotine or, The Smoke fairy” (1909), 5 mins; “The Confederate ironclad” (1912), 16 mins; “Hells hinges” (1916), 64 mins; “The Fall of the house of Usher” (1928), 13 mins; “From Groucho Marx’s home movies” (ca. 1933), 2 mins; From “Tevye” (1939), 17 mins; “Cologne: from the diary of Ray and Esther” (1939), 14 mins; Private Snafu: “Spies” (1943), 4 mins; “OffOn” (1968), 9 mins. Essays about the archives narrated by Laurence Fishburne. Newly recorded musical scores by Martin Marks. Further Information: http://www.filmpreservation.org/

results.title: Treasures from the American Film Archives: 50 preserved films (MS)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Treasures from the American Film Archives: 50 preserved films (DVD)”.
The program notes to the four-disk DVD set; 150 page book containing the full credits, transcribed commentary, detailed information on each film including preservation and soundtrack notes. Notes on the music by Martin Marks. Further information: www.filmpreservation.org.

results.title: Buffy the vampire slayer
results.creator_credit: Gareth Davies and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: For as long as there has been vampires, there’s been the slayer - one girl, hand picked out of the entire world as championing the cause against the creatures of the night. Join Buffy, Giles, Willow, Zander, Cordelia and Angel as they struggle to keep Sunnydale - town at the hellmouth, free from all that is evil, while still mainaining a killer sense of humour and a savvy sense of fashion.
